rows.COMMITMENT PROTOCOL — ROLLING 2-WEEK COM: Nobody commits to 12 weeks. Everyone commits to 2 weeks at a time. Re-up or exit cleanly. Hope becomes make.
A 12-week commitment on zero cash is a wish. A 2-week commitment is a real agreement.
Persistent roles (Librarian, MC, Conductor, Recruiter) are really just 6 consecutive 2-week sprints. They can exit after any sprint.
Flash roles (PM, Expert) are already 2-3 weeks. No change needed.
Monthly equity vesting means clean math at any exit point. No cliff drama.
The protocol survives turnover by design. Replacement in 48-72 hours. The show documents the transition. Turnover IS content.

rows.col_2: Commitment Unit
rows.col_3: What They're Committing To

rows.col_2: 2-week sprint
rows.col_3: File X tabs, route Y slices, maintain status tracker, respond within 24 hours to PM questions
rows.col_4: End of each 2-week sprint: "Want to continue for Sprint N+1?"
rows.col_5: Backup Librarian activates. Handoff packet generated by Claude. New Librarian operational in 24-48 hours.

rows.col_2: 10-episode block (~2 weeks)
rows.col_3: Produce 10 episodes: 4-6 long-form + 8-10 daily highlights
rows.col_4: After episode 10, 20, 30, etc.: "Want to continue for the next 10?"
rows.col_5: Show pauses or new MC takes over. Host change is documented on the show. Departing MC keeps vested equity + their episode reel.

rows.col_2: 2-week ops cycle
rows.col_3: Source 2-3 candidates, onboard 1-2 new people, manage scheduling for active clusters
rows.col_4: End of each 2-week cycle: "Want to continue for Cycle N+1?"
rows.col_5: Backup Conductor activates. Pipeline lives in shared doc. New Conductor picks up where old one left off.

rows.col_2: 2-week sourcing sprint
rows.col_3: Deliver 3-5 qualified candidates for specified roles. Screening complete. Ready for Nilo call.
rows.col_4: After each delivery: "More roles to fill?"
rows.col_5: If all roles filled, Recruiter exits naturally. If mid-hiring, backup activates or Conductor absorbs temporarily.

rows.col_2: 2-3 week cluster sprint
rows.col_3: Produce all C-tabs for assigned cluster. Submit for expert review.
rows.col_4: Sprint ends with V-tab. PM decides: "Take another cluster?" or exit.
rows.col_5: Clean exit. Equity vested for completed sprint. New PM takes next cluster.

rows.col_2: 1-2 week review cycle
rows.col_3: Review one cluster. Grade all TUPs. File V-tabs with per-tab notes.
rows.col_4: Review complete. Expert decides: "Review another cluster?" or exit.
rows.col_5: Clean exit. Equity vested. New expert for next cluster.

rows.COMMITMENT PROTOCOL — ROLLING 2-WEEK COM: Not a meeting. A Slack message. 30 seconds. Every person, every day.

rows.col_2: Check-In Format
rows.col_3: Channel

rows.col_2: "Filed: [X tabs]. Routed: [Y slices]. Blocked: [any issues]. Tomorrow: [plan]."
rows.col_3: #ops-log

rows.col_2: "Recorded: [episode X]. Published: [episode Y]. Tomorrow: [who I'm talking to]."
rows.col_3: #show-log

rows.col_2: "Sourced: [X candidates]. Onboarded: [Y people]. Scheduled: [Z calls]. Blocked: [any issues]."
rows.col_3: #ops-log

rows.col_2: "Outreach: [X messages]. Responses: [Y]. Screens scheduled: [Z]. Pipeline: [status]."
rows.col_3: #recruiting-log

rows.col_2: "Worked on: [tab names]. Status: [% complete]. Blocked: [any Claude issues or questions]. Tomorrow: [plan]."
rows.col_3: #production-log

rows.col_2: "Reviewed: [tab names]. Notes filed: [Y/N]. Grade status: [in progress / ready to file]."
rows.col_3: #review-log

rows.COMMITMENT PROTOCOL — ROLLING 2-WEEK COM: These are not "should we be worried" — these are automatic actions. No judgment calls.

rows.col_2: Trigger
rows.col_3: Automatic Action

rows.col_2: No check-in message for 24 hours. No response to DM within 24 hours.
rows.col_3: Ping backup. "Hey, [Name] has been silent 24 hours. You might be activated. Stand by."
rows.col_4: Conductor (or Nilo if Conductor is silent)

rows.col_2: No check-in for 48 hours. No response to any communication.
rows.col_3: Backup formally activated. Handoff packet generated. Departing person notified: "We're activating your backup. If you want to continue, respond within 24 hours."

rows.col_2: No response after activation notice.
rows.col_3: Role transferred to backup. Departing person's access revoked. Exit documented on show (if they agree) or noted privately. Equity vests for time served.

rows.col_2: Sprint ends without deliverable submitted. No communication about delay.
rows.col_3: Same as Silent 48 — backup ping. If delay is communicated, extend 48 hours once. If second miss, escalate to backup.

rows.col_2: Two consecutive C grades or one D grade.
rows.col_3: Post-mortem conversation (recorded for show). PM can continue with support or exit cleanly. No automatic firing — but documented conversation about what went wrong.

rows.COMMITMENT PROTOCOL — ROLLING 2-WEEK COM: At the end of every commitment unit (2 weeks, 10 episodes, etc.), there's a 10-minute re-up conversation.
MC records it. It's content. "Sprint 3 complete. Here's what [Name] did. They're continuing / they're exiting. Here's what's next."
If continuing: "What do you need for the next sprint? Any blockers? Any support?" Then handshake and go.
If exiting: "Thank you. Here's your vested equity. Here's your reel/portfolio. Exit conversation is Episode [X]." Clean.
Nobody is guilted into staying. Nobody is surprised by leaving. The re-up ritual makes both explicit.
PUBLIC ACCOUNTABILITY (the show as commitment device)
Your entrance is on camera. Your check-ins are logged. Your deliverables are reviewed on camera. Your exit is documented.
This is not surveillance — it's accountability via visibility. Harder to ghost when 1,000 people are watching the story.
The show creates social cost for flaking. Not punishment — just the natural consequence of being part of a public narrative.
Experts' names are permanently on V-tabs. A lazy B+ is public forever. Reputation skin in the game.
PMs' work is graded on camera. The expert review episode shows exactly how good (or not) the work was.

rows.col_2: Make
Rolling 10-episode commitments. Check-ins daily. Tripwires at 24/48/72 hours. Backup on standby.
Rolling 2-week sprints. Check-ins daily. Deliverables are binary (tabs filed or not). Tripwires automatic.
Expert grades on camera. Raw Claude submission = C or D grade = public. Reputation cost enforces effort.
Per-tab notes required. Grade without notes rejected. Name permanently on V-tab. Reputation skin in game.
2-week deliverable: 3-5 qualified candidates. Miss = tripwire. Quality visible in who actually joins.
24-hour tripwire. 48-hour backup activation. 72-hour transfer. Automatic, not discretionary.
